column3: Not sure what you mean. The cache is populated and everything is green: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6695630107049984?logs=previous_releases#L2
It is also greeen without cache: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5560067312320512?logs=previous_releases#L1
> Not sure what you mean.\n\nJust trying to answer to myself "What is the role of the previous releases cache in the CI setup? Speedup what?"
I think the idea of the cache is to avoid downloading the previous releases from bitcoincore.org every test run?
> I think the idea of the cache is to avoid downloading the previous releases from bitcoincore.org every test run?\n\nAgree. But currently it does not work like that.

It does:

```
Releases directory: /tmp/cirrus-build/releases/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Using cached v0.15.2
Using cached v0.16.3
Using cached v0.17.2
Using cached v0.18.1
Using cached v0.19.1
```

https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6695630107049984?logs=ci#L1993
> It does:\n\nRight. It is responsibility of [`test/get_previous_releases.py`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/get_previous_releases.py).
